resources.name: Get user
resources.description:
Attempts to get the currently signed-in user.

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:
```json
{
	"id": 3498984026931200,
	"username": "Josh",
	"created_ms": 1668445599953,
	"mfa_enabled": false,
	"avatar_url": "./avatar/3498984026931200",
	"email": "joshua.merlino@gmail.com",
	"sessions": [ ... ],
	"passwd_md5": "b3f1cda1-035c-54ea-a936-9a71416852ae",
	"passwd_length": 9,
	"passwd_changed_ms": 1668445599953,
	"authorization": "cce0b110-6442-11ed-9861-03ace2f44f7d",
	"roles": [],
	"flags": 2
}
```

resources.name: Authentication Server
resources.description: Easily implement authentication into your app with this Authentication Server for NodeJS.

resources.name: Delete account
resources.description:
Attempts to delete the currently signed-in user.

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": true
}
```

resources.name: Update user
resources.description:
Attempts to modify the currently signed-in user.

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Request body
| field | required | type | description |
| - | - | - | - |
| `username` | no | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The new username to assign to the user. |
| `email` | no | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The new email address to assign to the user. |
| `password` | no | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The new password to assign to the user. |

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:
```json
{
    "id": 0,
    "username": "...",
    "email": "...",
    "passwd_md5": "...",
    "passwd_length": 0,
    "passwd_changed_ms": 0,
    "created_ms": 0,
    "mfa_enabled": false,
    "avatar_url": "...",
    "authorization": "..."
}
```

resources.name: get
resources.description:
Gets the image of a users profile picture.

## Request parameters
| field | required | type | description |
| - | - | - | - |
| `:userid` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The user ID for the user that you want to recieve the profile picture for. |

## Response
Response is the file uploaded by the user encoded as PNG.

resources.name: reset
resources.description:
Attempts to reset the currently signed-in user's profile picture to its default.

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": true
}
```

resources.name: upload
resources.description:
Attempts to upload a new profile picture forthe currently signed-in user.

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Request
* The request must have the `Content-Type` header when uploading a file.
* Request body should be file instance from the browser.

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": true
}
```

resources.name: Confirm password
resources.description:
Confirms the currently signed-in users password.

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Example request
## Request body
| field | required | type | description |
| - | - | - | - |
| `password` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The password to verify if its correct. |

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "requested_checksum": "...",
    "local_checksum": "..."
}
```

resources.name: Create Account
resources.description:
Creates a new user.

## Request body
| field | required | type | description |
| - | - | - | - |
| `username` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The username to assign to the user. |
| `email` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The email address to assign to the user. |
| `password` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The password to assign to the user. |

## Successful response
On successful response, the server will issue an internal redirect *307* to `./session` endpoint. This will automaticly create a session and authenticate the newly created user.

resources.name: Account details
resources.description:
Gets public information about a user account by email address.

## Request body
| field | required | type | description |
| - | - | - | - |
| `email` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The email address of the user. |

## Example responses
### Example of a successful request:
```json
{
    "id": 0,
    "username": "...",
    "created_ms": 0,
    "mfa_enabled": false,
    "avatar_url": "...",
    "email": "..."
}
```

resources.name: Disable
resources.description:
Disables Two-Factor Authentication for a user account.

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successful request:
```json
{
    "success": true
}
```

Starts the enabling process for Two-Factor Authentication for the acccount.

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Example responses

```json
{
    "success": false,

}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:

```json
{
    "qr": "..."
}
```

resources.name: Confirm setup
resources.description:
Completes Two-Factor Authentication setup for an account.

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Request body
| field | required | type | description |
| - | - | - | - |
| `token` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The token obtained from the 2fa app. |

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": true
}
```

resources.name: create
resources.description:
Authorizes credentials and generates a session ID.

## Body fields
| field | required | type | description |
| - | - | - | - |
| `email` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The email address for the user. |
| `password` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The password for the user. |
| `token` | only if requested | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | Specifies the 2fa token for the authentication. |
| `rememberme` | no | [boolean](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean) | If specified, makes the session never expire. |

## Successful response
On successful response, this endpoint will set a cookie *`session_id`* and internally redirect to `./@me`.

resources.name: list
resources.description:
Retrieves a list of all sessions that the user is logged in with (on any device).

### Order of authentication
1. **`Authorization` header.**
    The authorization header accepts a `session_id`, a Session ID can be obtained from authenticating with the **PUT** `./session` endpont.
2. **Session ID Cookie.** If no authorization header is sent, the endpoint will use the cookie `session_id` to authorize the request. The `session_id` cookie is automaticly set from the **PUT** `./session` endpont and will be stored and sent with subsequent requests in most browsers.

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:
```json
{
    "sessions": [{
        "id": 0,
        "session_id": "...",
        "created_ms": 0,
        "last_used_ms": 0,
        "user_agent": {
            "ua": "...",
            "browser": {},
            "engine": {},
            "os": {},
            "device": {},
            "cpu": {}
        },
        "ip_address": "...",
        "current_session": false
    }]
}
```

resources.name: delete
resources.description:
Revokes a session ID (logs out user).

## Body fields
| field | required | description |
| - | - | - |
| `session_id` | no | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The session ID to log out of. Defaults to the current session ID. |
| `all` | no | [boolean](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean) | If true, signs out of all sessions on all devices. |

## Example responses
### Example of a unauthenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": false,
    "error": "401 Unauthorized",
    "description": "You likley do not have a valid session token."
}
```

### Example of a successfully authenticated request:
```json
{
    "success": true
}
```

| `email` | yes | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The email address of the user. |

## Example responses
### Example of a successful request:
```json
{
    "success": true
```
